meanings.definition: Having eyes that are wide open or bulging in a strange or staring manner.
meanings.sent1: The goggly frog stared at me with its big, bulging eyes.
meanings.sent2: She gave me a goggly look when I told her the surprising news.
meanings.sent3: The goggly owl blinked rapidly, trying to focus its wide-open eyes.
meanings.sent4: His goggly expression made him appear as if he had seen a ghost.
meanings.sent5: The goggly fish in the tank seemed to be constantly surprised by everything.

meanings.definition: A look or stare that is wide-eyed or staring in an odd or unsettling way.
meanings.sent1: I couldn't help but notice the goggly stare of the old man sitting on the bench.
meanings.sent2: The child's goggly gaze made me feel a bit uneasy.
meanings.sent3: The goggly eyes of the portrait seemed to follow me around the room.
meanings.sent4: She gave me a goggly look that made me wonder what she was thinking.
meanings.sent5: The goggly expression on his face made me think he had seen something shocking.
